step1.sentence: Even after her colleague took credit for her work, she decided to take the high road and not retaliate.

step2.story: After losing the election, Marcus was tempted to expose his rival's past mistakes. But he chose to take the high road, congratulating his opponent and wishing him well. The crowd respected him more for it than if he had won.

step3.story: The argument had been going on for weeks, and everyone in the office knew about it. David had every reason to fight back — his manager had publicly criticized his work unfairly. His friends urged him to confront her, to make noise, to defend himself loudly. Instead, David decided to take the high road. He quietly documented his contributions, improved his work even further, and addressed concerns professionally without casting blame. When the year-end review came, his results spoke for themselves, and his composure had earned him the trust of everyone who mattered.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 높은 길을 택하다 — 즉, 더 고결하거나 도덕적으로 우월한 방향을 선택한다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 갈등이나 분쟁 상황에서 보복하거나 감정적으로 반응하는 대신, 원칙과 품위를 지키며 행동하는 것을 표현할 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 스코틀랜드 민요 'Loch Lomond'에서 유래한 것으로 알려져 있으며, '높은 길(high road)'은 명예롭고 올바른 방향을 상징적으로 의미하게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 침묵하는 것이 아니라 어려운 상황에서 도덕적 우위를 지킨다는 능동적인 뉘앙스가 강하며, 성숙함과 자기 절제를 함께 암시한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She chose to take the high road and forgive him rather than hold a grudge.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 원한을 품는 대신 그를 용서하며 원칙을 지키는 길을 택했다.
